channel.title: Productivity in Tech: Reflections
channel.description: Reflections from founder of Productivity in Tech, Jay Miller. This podcast was created to encourage you to start thinking about what happened in your day and what you can learn from it.

item.title: Reflection 63: Too Much Automation and Figuring Out What Works for Me
item.description:
I lost a podcast episode for the first time. This was due to too much automation happening.

  • Gemini
  • Hazel App

I also have come to the desicion that I'm going to be sticking with analog productivity for the forseeable future. It's what works best for me and while I'm still figuring it all out, I think I'm on the right track.

item.title: Reflection 62: Preparing for May
item.description:
The video for this post is available here on our YouTube channel.

Watch the Video Now

My Focus for the month of May: LEAN

item.title: Reflection 61: Youtube and a Productivity Detox
item.description:
I've been doing daily videos. These have been a lot of fun and I don't put a lot of pressure on myself with them. It's been a great way to think about ideas more and more.

I'm also in the midst of a productivity detox. This is when I stop doing things that I would normally do in order to reethink my planning and collecting of tasks.

Also there is no PITPodcast due to Easter.

item.title: Reflection 60: The Only Fool was Me
item.description:
What happened this week!

CoWorker pushed an update that caused a lot of work for me.

I pushed an update that caused a lot of work for me.

Lesson Learned

Set the expectation with your team. - Let them know if you can't handle more work - be okay saying no

Think about how your actions will affect your productivity

Plans for the weekend

  • Actually edited the podcast episode early
  • Doing a couple interviews
  • Heading to LA on Sunday

item.title: Reflection 59: Weekly Update and Filling In
item.description:
This week was hectic.

I got to meet Rob and Saron in person for the first time.

I also had to fill in for one of my coworkers. This meant that I deploy the 2.5x rule.

item.title: Reflection 58: So Many Distractions
item.description:
I found out the drain from our house has finally worn down.

This and many other distractions have made getting anything done this week very hard.

item.title: Reflection 57: Being "Too Busy" for Work
item.description: This PITReflection, I address a post from the Facebook group about being "too busy" at work.

item.title: Reflection 56: Celebrating our Birthday with more Personal Reflections!
item.description:
The PITReflections is going back to its old format, but Lee is going to be joining in on the fun bringing his own reflections.

Also...

Productivity in Tech is a Year Old!!

Its been a fun year and I've learned a lot. We have a lot of cool things coming in year.

item.title: Reflection 55: What PIT is Meant to Be
item.description:
Jay has been working on some things for quite a while. It's time that he finishes some of these projects that he's placed.

Jay talks a bit about making better decisions.

  • The 5 Whys and 5 Hows - When Clarity Is Just Two Questions Away | Inside Swip

item.title: Reflection 54: Another Pitfall in the System and the Jay's new Apple Watch
item.description:
Jay finds another problem but thinks he has a compromise. Also, Jay got an Apple Watch and talks about how it has affected his productivity.

Great Asynchronous Chat Tools

  • Slack

Project Managers

  • Basecamp
  • Trello

Flaws with two profiles

  • homebrew
  • Why you should use Spaces

Keyboard Maestro to Quit All

item.title: Reflection 53: 1 Frog or 100 Crickets
item.description:
Jay spends some time thinking about my new idea and explaining my bad procrastination habit.

  • Noah Kagan Presents
  • Rejection Proof - Jia Jang
  • Rejection Therapy – The Original Rejection Therapy Game – Rejection Therapy by Jia Jiang

  • Beleaf is Quitting Rap - YouTube

  • My MindMap

  • The Minimalists

  • Productivity in Tech Podcast 43:Tired of Turning Wrenches with Alex Esparza – Productivity in Tech

item.title: Reflection 52: Why Habits and Thinking about an Isolation Setup
item.description:
In this session, Lee and I talk about the benefits and drawbacks to habit trackers and then I reveal my potential breakthrough in my podcasting system.

Links

  • Coach.me
  • Momentum
  • Calm: Meditation to Relax, Focus & Sleep Better on the App Store
  • Headspace
item.itunes:keywords: mac, podcast, recording, system, habits, gamification

item.title: Reflection 51: Simplifying the Experience
item.description: In this episode, We recap the results from the gratitude journal and work on identifying key places to simplify my workflow.

item.title: Reflection 50: The Gratitude Journal
item.description:
The first session for Jay and Lee. Jay shares his concerns about not being happy with his setup and Lee makes an unexpected suggestion. 

Links

  • The most Successful Email I Ever Wrote by Derek Sivers
  • 20 Ways Gratitude Improves Productivity
  • Day One
  • The Five-Minute Journal

If you are interested in hiring Lee as a Productivity Coach you can sign up now through Coach.Me and receive a free week of coaching using the code: LEETWEEK. 

Intro/Outro Music Low Battery Blues by Martijn de Boer (NiGiD) (c) copyright 2014 Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Noncommercial (3.0) license. http://dig.ccmixter.org/files/NiGiD/48615 Ft: Javolenus

item.title: Reflection 49: NEW FORMAT - Coaching from Lee Stetson
item.description:
We are kicking off a new format for the PITReflections. I have decided that I will be enlisting the help of a productivity coach. This year, quickly becoming the "year of guidance", I will be working to make myself and Productivity in Tech better in 2017.

Lee and I will be chatting three days a week and two of the three will be recorded while a middle of the week update will be available on our blog!

Be sure to check out Lee's coaching page on Coach.me

Lee Stetson

  • Coach.me
  • The Advantages of having a coach with Lee Tratnyeck

item.title: Reflection 48: The Balance between Planning and Executing
item.description:
Yesterday I was encouraged while planning my next moves on a project at work. I reached out to a friend in the field and as I began to explain my potential solution, he let me know that I was working outside of the realm of his job and knowledge.

There are plenty of things that we want to see happen in the productivity space, but we can't limit ourselves to being just an productivity planner and a productivity architect. We must ensure there is balance.
item.itunes:keywords: productivity planning, design, implementation, newsletter, balance

item.title: Reflection 47: 2017 PIT Resolutions
item.description:
title: 2017 PIT Resolutions tags: resolution episode_number: 47 media_url: http://productivityintech.com/files/podcast/pitreflections_47.mp3 duration: 14:18

I normally don't do resolutions for the new year, but this year I have made a few resolutions for Productivity in Tech and its community.

item.title: Reflection 46: Returning from the Break and Breaking Things Down with OSMEAC
item.description:
This past week I enjoyed a day off and spent time relaxing with my family for the holidays.

When I got back into the swing of things, I used a little technique from my military days to start planning. The OSMEAC.

In this reflection, I break down the OSMEAC in hopes that you can use it in planning for your nect project.

  • Prepare for a Big Road Trip With The "OSMEAC" Military Convoy Technique
  • SMART Goals

item.title: Reflection 45: They Threw a Bunch of Stuff at the Fan, But it was Cool
item.description:
Yesterday, a lot of things came my way, but it was okay. I can definitely see the benefit of journaling in my personal growth!

Here is a recap of yesterday!

  • A bunch of work got thrown on my lap after lunch.. Couldn't get it all done, but it's no big deal.
  • The older Productivity in Tech Podcast episodes (anything before PIT 36) got removed from libsyn. I have copies but I will be fixing that over the weekend.
  • I was asked by Martin St. Macary to be a Vyte Ambassador! Not quite sure what the commitment level is but I'm super honored!

A special thanks to everyone that listens to the reflections and lets me know their thoughts. The emotional rollercoaster of this day would have been a lot for me, but thanks to these reflections I am starting to get a better grip on my file and responsibilities.

Again, A HUGE Thanks!

item.title: Reflection 44: I Understand Why the Holidays were so Silent
item.description:
Sorry about not having many episodes last week. Food poisoning and fatigue got the best of me.

I made the decision to not release Productivity in Tech Podcast episodes over the Christmas and New Years Holidays. I've noticed that I haven't been giving enough time to my family and I really want to make sure that I am balancing my life. So although I will be upset that there are no podcasts for me to listen to, I will also not be publishing (except for these! I like doing these!).

item.title: Reflection 43: Don't Let Yourself go Unchecked
item.description:
So I couldn't let PITReflections 42 go unchecked. Man that thing was DEPRESSING!

I made yesterday sound absolutely terrible and that's not fair so I decided to do a second reflection for yesterday.

After my meeting I had a pretty quiet day and was able to put in some focus tracks (DJ Okawari is the best).

After dinner (Fried Chicken and homemade french fries), I completed the PITPodcast for next week! So excited to have that already done.
item.itunes:keywords: positive vibes, good feelings, motivated, hustle

item.title: Reflection 42: PSA About Anxiety, and My Personal Struggle Yesterday
item.description:
I had one of my regular meetings. I tdidn't think I was prepared for it. Everyone seemed okay with the amount of information that I presented and there was even some greatitude for the work that I put in.

I sat down with my boss who was also in the meeting for some mid-day reflection. He reassured me that I did very well but also reminded me that it is okay to be wrong (see PITReflections: 24).

This got me wondering about my own anxiety. Why did I not think that I had done enough. maybe I could have done more and my own guilt was attacking me. Maybe since I am expecting my review soon, I don't know the perception of performance level which leads me to think negatively of myself.

I often let anxiety beat up on me. I wasn't really bullied as a kid and I had a lot of encouragement in my life so I can't chalk it up to that. I don't know why I always feel inadequate. It could be because I dropped out of college, or that I struggle with focusing on one thing at a time. Perhaps, it's because I have lofty ambitions and hoped to see myself farther than where I am today. Perhaps it's because my current success has been due to this same style of thought over the past decade and I'm afraid to think differently.

What I do know is that there is nothing should have me hyperventilating in the bathroom just seconds away from throwing up like B-Rabbit in 8 Mile.

My friend Chad Bostick is working on a book that helps nerds like me fight anxiety. I can't wait for it to come out. This anxiety gets the best of me although I know that I most likely have nothing to worry about. Perhaps I should get some help. Perhaps I should chain it up and control it.

I hope I'm not the only one that thinks like this. I'm sure that I'm not. What are some ways that you defeat anxiety and depression.

ASIDE: This isn't to say that I'm depressed. I woke up this morning feeling quite happy and excited for today. This is just a reflection on my most challenging thoughts from yesterday. I try to take the good with the bad and show myself with full transparency.

item.title: Reflection 41: Thinking Exercises are a Great Way to Regain Motivation
item.description:
I've been dealing with low energy and enthusiasm towards many of the projects I've needed to accomplish lately. This is common for many people and, if left unchecked, is the first step towards burnout.

Something I did yesterday was a thinking exercise that challenged my knowledge on algorithms and statistics. If you keep up with me in the one of the few slack channels that I monitor these days, you may have seen me asking around for solutions to a problem. This problem wasn't critical, but it was a puzzling one.

I learned a lot while trying to solve the question.

Takeaways

  • What is the real solution that you are looking for?
  • Can you visualize your solution a different way?
  • How can this issue apply to multiple problems in your life?

item.title: Reflection 40: PITQuestion! How do I Prevent Eye Strain and Headaches Without Taking More Breaks?
item.description:
Yesterday, I suffered from a headache while at work. Trying to prevent the headache from getting worse, I kept taking short 5 minute breaks. These breaks did not seem to help and only removed the momentum that I had been building.

Takeaways

#pitquestion How do I prevent eyestrain and headaches without taking more breaks? - @kjaymiller

— Productivity In Tech (@prodintech) December 8, 2016
item.itunes:keywords: question, eye strain, software, productivity, momentum

item.title: Reflection 39: I Need to Own Up to My Mistakes
item.description:
The past few days have been full of mistakes!

  • PIT Reflections 38: I'm not Perfect, but Nobody Said I was
  • PIT Reflections 37: Get that Frustration out Before you Make a Mistake
  • PIT Reflections 34: 34: Don't Let False Starts Ruin Your Performance

Yesterday was another painful experience. Today, my negligence landed me with a $450 bill for a service that will not help me in any way.

At first I was angry at them, but after a while I realized that I had no one to be mad at but myself.

TakeAways

  • Start your day with a positive mindset.
  • Look at the problem from all points of view (Not just yours, Not just theirs)
  • Make sure you own up to your mistakes, don't pass the blame.

item.title: Reflection 38: I'm not Perfect, but Nobody Said I was.
item.description:
I lost part of a podcast file. It sucks because that means I cannot release that episode. It also sucks because to me it makes me feel bad.

I'm supposed to be one of the productive people. I feel like it reflects poorly on me to not be organized and lose stuff.

Overall I'm reminded of a few things.

TakeAways

  • I'm not perfect.
  • I can't leave parts of your system unchecked.
  • I have to be forgiving of myself.

item.title: Reflection 37: Get that Frustration out Before you Make a Mistake
item.description:
Yesterday, I got really frustrated and it started affecting my performance. Instead of exploding and being irrational, I decided that I would post my frustration on a service that people wouldn't see (at least not for very long)

Follow me on SnapChat

Also I'm still not ready for 2016 to end. There's so much to do.

@kayla_hollatz oh man I'm still working on 2016.... Is it already time to start thinking about next year?!?

— Jay Miller (@kjaymiller) December 2, 2016

Links

  • Kayla Hollatz
  • CreateLounge Podcast

Takeaway for Today:

  • Don't just hold all your anger in. You will just do something that you regret. Instead, release it in a way that doesn't get you into trouble.
item.itunes:keywords: frustration, anger, snapchat, relaxation, kayla hollatz, createlounge

item.title: Reflection 36: Under the Weather. Good Thing It's going to be a Low Power Kind of Day
item.description:
I'm not feeling well this morning. But luckily, yesterday I spent the entire day ordering phones so today will be the setups and I will be able to relax a bit.

Takeaway for Today:

  • Setup your day so that you can relax when you aren't feeling well.

item.title: Reflection 35: Ask for Help! How I Struggle with My Own Advice
item.description:
I had people offering to help me handle some of the administrative work that I do for NCSD Entrprenuers. I'm not used to having the help but I'm thinking that I will do it.

Links

  • NCSD Entreprenuers
  • PIT 17: Empowering your team with Lucas Miles
  • PythonMonthly

Takeaway for Today:

  • Let people help you so that you have more time to do what you do best.

item.title: Reflection 34: Don't Let False Starts Ruin Your Performance
item.description:
Yesterday I had a terrible start to my day and it carried on into the rest of the day. I definitely let the false start ruin my performance.

Takeaway for Today:

  • Don't Be afraid to start your day over.
  • Get Help from those that have been in your position or understand your situation.

item.title: Reflection 33: Dedicated Time is Awesome
item.description:
For the first time in a very long time, I was able to focus on projects without distraction. This was because I allotted the first half of my day to focus and knock out some of these goals.

Takeaway for Today:

  • If you can come up with a set amount of time. You can actually achieve goals faster and get in the zone quicker.
item.itunes:keywords: focus, time, control, goals, actions, planning

item.title: Reflection 32: Making a Template From What Didn't Work
item.description:
Yesterday, I was asked to make a banner for work. The image that they gave me wasn't the right size and I was then asked to find a replacement image that would be suitable. Instead of just starting from scratch, I took the image that I had and made it into an approriate template. I cut off the pieces that I didn't need and then used the square as a starting point to figure out what my file would need to look like.

Takeaway for Today:

  • If something in your life doesn't fit, try to use it as a template to find what does.
item.itunes:keywords: repurpose, productivity, life lessons, learning, reflections

item.title: Reflection 31: Three Lessons on Consideration
item.description:
The past couple of mornings, I've been on both sides of the lacking consideration bug. Yesterday I saw kids of different ages show a lack of consideration, only to see their parents not correct them. Then across last week I didn't show consideration when I didn't keep my word. In doing this, I may have ruined a really great opportunity for mentorship and to establish a great relationship with someone I really look up to.

It sucks when you see others lacking consideration, but it REALLY sucks when you catch yourself not showing it.

I have apologized and now I have to push forward and change my behaviours. It doesn't matter how much you learn if you don't apply it to your life.

Takeaway for Today

  • Consideration for others not only allows you to see their side, but can help establish lasting relationships in business and life.

item.title: Reflection 30: Be Who you Want to Be
item.description:
I was asked a few times by family members what I was doing nowadays. Instead of telling them about my job. I took the oppotunity to tell them about the podcast and the communitites that I work with.

Although this opportunity didn't turn into anything I really believe that if you let people know what you are doing (or trying to do) you will have a more opportunities to grow into that role.

There have been plenty of times that people have sent me information because they thought about what I did for a job and it seemed relevant. If you are trying to do something in your life and people are reminded of that, they will be able to give you information that more aligns with where you want to be not with where you are.

Links

  • Episode 02 of the Productivity in Tech Podcast with Tiffany White

Takeaway for Today (Click to Tweet)

  • Introduce yourself as what you want to be, not who you currently are.

item.title: Reflection 29: Let's Play Together
item.description:
My wife and I are going to be playing Pokemon Sun and Moon together. I have not been that into pokemon in quite some time. I didn't actually want the games. I did think it would be a fun experience for my wife and I to play together.

There are plenty of things that I don't like to do alone. When I am with my wife that list becomes much shorter.

When we work as a team our mindset shifts.

Links

  • Reframe "Negative" Emotions as "Difficult" Emotions
  • Mindfulness Can Literally Change Your Brain

Takeaway for Today (Click to Tweet)

  • Liven up a task with a little teamwork.
  • Working as a team can adjust your mindset or the dificulty of a task.

item.title: Reflection 28: Finding Passion in your Job instead of Chasing it
item.description:
Today I rant about the "chase your dreams mentality and how I find passion in my non-passion job"

This reflections was inspired by Martin Leiberman's Tweet.

Would YOU say you love 90% of the things about working in your industry? https://t.co/V0osSpcc4g (via @JonAcuff)

— Martin Lieberman (@martinlieberman) November 18, 2016

Takeaways for Today (Click to Tweet)

  • Just because your job isn't your passion, doesn't mean that you can't have some passion in your job.
  • If there is a little passion in your job, then work to be able to do that thing more often.

item.title: Reflection 27: Be Like Oolong and Get Better with Each Attempt
item.description:
I was a part of the first ever San Diego North County Entreprenuers meetup. I had a great time with the people that showed up. We not only talked about businesses and the issues that we see with them sometimes, but we also discussed something that I enjoy but am not too familiar with, Tea.

I decided to purchase an oolong tea set. The cool thing about oolong is that you make several cups quickly and the tea gets better over time.

My #oolong #tea setup

A photo posted by Jay Miller (@kjaymiller) on Nov 17, 2016 at 6:13am PST

Just like oolong the more we try something the easier it gets. I often do things in quick succession in order to master a small task..

Some tea experts!! Johan Gustaphzon Martin Lindeskog

My Takeaways for today (Click to Tweet)

  • Keep trying! Be like Oolong and get with each attempt.

item.title: Reflection 26: Thanksgiving Makeup Episode
item.description:
Takeaway for Today:

  • It is all of you that make me better and for that I have to thank you so much!

item.title: Reflection 25: I'M Back And I Was Able To Do It!
item.description:
It's so great to be back!

I've been working extremely hard to get everything moved over. If you want to know everything that I accomplished be sure to check out my blog post about it.

Takeaways for today (Click to Tweet):

  • You don't know how what you are capable of until you try it
  • Automate before you delegate. It could save you a few dollars

item.title: Reflection 24: Alright To Be Wrong
item.description:
I was wrong earlier. I yelled at Playstation because of my misunderstanding of one of their services.

@playstation you are advertising the world series on Fox but your fox lineup is ondemand.... and doesn't show the series. pic.twitter.com/EZcdBkcPk4

— Jay Miller (@kjaymiller) October 30, 2016

How do you handle being wrong? Do you lash out in rage? Do you defend your point?

Do you humbly admit your wrongdoing?

@PlayStation oh my mistake you don't have fox live in San Diego... awesome pic.twitter.com/n5Vf4YNFwp

— Jay Miller (@kjaymiller) October 30, 2016

We actually sound smarter when we admit when we're wrong. You also will draw people to want to help you more.

PS: In this episode I say that the Vue TV doesn't let you watch the Super Bowl. I meant "World Series"

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

  • Be quick to admit when you're wrong.
  • Instead of always trying to be right, learn from when you are wrong.
  • Don't waste time defending your wrongdoing. Apologize and move on.
  • You sound smarter when we admit when we're wrong.
  • Admitting that you're wrong will draw people to want to help you more.

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Join our Facebook Group Follow us on Twitter Help Support Productivity in Tech

item.title: Reflection 23: Treat it Like your Life
Reflection 22: Focus on the One Thing
item.itunes:subtitle: October 26, 2016
item.description:
This week I reveal a technique that I sometimes use to stay focused on just one thing.

 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

In most cases it's often better to just focus on (ONLY) one thing.

  

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Join our Facebook Group

Follow us on Twitter

 

Help Share Productivity in Tech

item.title: Reflection 21: #JustBeSocial
item.itunes:subtitle:
So I have my first rant on PITReflections. Earier today I posted the following tweet.

I can't fathom how you tweet 100 times in 5 days and they are all links and no engagem
item.description:
So I have my first rant on PITReflections. Earier today I posted the following tweet.

I can't fathom how you tweet 100 times in 5 days and they are all links and no engagement. pic.twitter.com/nxbdLiSN2J

— Jay Miller (@kjaymiller) October 26, 2016

This came after I gathered a new follower and when I went to check them out, they had no engagement. I went back for the last 5 days worth of tweets and there weren’t any replies or tweets other than them promoting their product or sending out link titles and names. This seemed like terrible engagement and reminded me of the awesome people trying to help people to #JustBeSocial

Takeaways

  • Be social and don’t let things like influence or the promise of potential clients sway you. #justbesocial.

 

If you want to support Productivity in Tech, head to:

productivityintech.com/support

 

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Join our Facebook Group

Follow us on Twitter

item.title: Reflection 20: You Shouldn't Help Everyone
item.itunes:subtitle: I tried helping someone and it could have gotten me in trouble. It made me think about all the things that I may have helped with out of some sick form of obligation. I wanted to encourage you and let you know that you don't have to help people...
item.description:
I tried helping someone and it could have gotten me in trouble. It made me think about all the things that I may have helped with out of some sick form of obligation. 

I wanted to encourage you and let you know that you don't have to help people make horrible decisions. It can bring you down and will only make things worse.

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

You don't have to help someone make bad decisions out of obligation.

  

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Join our Facebook Group

item.title: Reflection 19: Don't be a Know it All
item.itunes:subtitle: October 24, 2016
item.description:
I learned something new today in an area that I thought I was pretty familiar (or so I thought).

Just a reminder of how much I still didn't know.

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

  • Even when you know a lot, you probably don't know it all.

item.itunes:subtitle: I made from horrible assumptions about Tijuana. I actually enjoyed my time very much. Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities Join our Facebook Group productivityintech.com/fb Follow us on Twitter Twitter - @prodintech ...

item.title: Reflection 17: Make Some Time so You can Stay on Track
item.itunes:subtitle: October 20, 2016
item.description:
I had a little bit of a reflection from Anthony Gauna's Vlog and I thought I would talk a little about why I even do reflections. 

I really believe that if you don't take some time for yourself and "meditate" you allow things to stay in your head. 

In this reflection I talk about staying on the right track and how to course correct. 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet)

  • You have to take time for yourself
  • Check you course frequently and adjust when necessary

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

  • Join our Facebook Group
  • Follow us on Twitter

item.title: Reflection 16: Going Forward, Going LIVE
item.itunes:subtitle: October 19, 2016
item.description:
Today I held the first pitreflections LIVE! To catch the next one, be sure to join the Productivity in Tech Facebook group!

Tonight I talk about the stress that I had discovering that I had overbooked for the podcast.

I came up with a plan and decided to readjust and make moves to keep pushing forward.

 

My Takeaways for today (Click to Tweet)

  • Set yourself up for success
  • Make quality connections with people whose strength are your weaknesses
  • Always make moves that propel you forward

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Join our Facebook Group

Follow us on Twitter

Give us a rating on iTunes, 

Pledge via Patreon

Give a one-time donation

item.title: Reflection 15: Don't be "Chicken". Just ask
item.itunes:subtitle: October 18, 2016
item.description:
As I sat in the drive through I thought I would reflect on something that happened to me today. 

I messed up my favorite air of boots while working today. But instead of just complaining or sulking about it. I decided to speak up and ask the company controller to reimburse me for the damages, AND SHE SAID YES.

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet)

  • Don't be afraid to ask for something you feel you need.

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Join our Facebook Group

Follow us on Twitter

 

Help Share Productivity in Tech:

Give us a rating on iTunes, 

Pledge via Patreon

One-Time Donation

item.title: Reflection 14: Discover the true nature of people
item.itunes:subtitle: October 17, 2016
item.description:
Queen Elizabeth II is the Queen of the United Kingdom. While her subjects know better, many foreigners to the British Isles may often refer to her as the Queen of England. Why because although she was born in London. Her lineage is more that of German Descent (SIDENOTE: I say "Scottish" in the podcast. I think that's wrong. I misunderstood the person giving me the information).

This little history lesson got me thinking about the true nature of others. There will be people that seem for or against you or your thoughts. I've come to realize that often times we think the best or worst of people because of their appearance, where they live, or what little we know of them. 

If you choose to not seek the true intentions of others you may end up coming out on the losing end of things. 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet)  

  • Always try to understand the true nature of those around you.

item.title: Reflection 13: So Little Anxiety
item.itunes:subtitle: October 16, 2016
item.description:
I spent this weekend with very limited usage of my phone. I wound up not getting a lot of emails and notifications that tend to happen. 

It was a great feeling

 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet)

  • Make sure the things you are anxious for are worth the anxiety

item.title: Reflection 12: Your Environment Dictates your Output
item.itunes:subtitle: October 13, 2016
item.description:
I've had the opportunity to change my work environment for a few weeks. Just by adding some lighting. I've genuinely been happier at work. This got me thinking about my overall work environment. 

My Tips

  • Be Comfortable (transition between sitting and standing)
  • Create an environment that feels like you.

 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet)

  • Make sure the area you work is an area worth the work that you are doing.
  • Your work will be a reflection of your area.

item.title: Reflection 11: Don't Blow Smoke
item.itunes:subtitle: October 12, 2016 w/ special guest Alex Esparza
item.description:
Tonight my brother Alex Esparza joins us as we share our reflections from the SDTECH Mixer. 

I (as well as Alex) met a lot of people and learn some amazing things. I can't wait to chat with them again and have a few of them on the show!

I also learned through failure that I need to stick to what has worked for me. 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

Jay - Be Like Who? Nah! Just be YOU!

Alex - Don't blow smoke. Be who you are now not who you pretend to be to impress others.

item.title: Reflection 10: Pushing through the Pain
item.itunes:subtitle: October 11, 2016
item.description:
My Leg Hurts a LOT!

My weekly bowling league night was a little more painful than usual. Having overworked (Another lesson learned) my knee and thigh were not feeling too great. 

I started off bowling well but eventually the pain was something I was struggle to block out. Eventually, I got it out of my head and was able to bowl better than I was before.

In many things that we do. There are plenty of "pain" points. We don't know if we can continue. It feels like too much to handle but at the end of the day we are able to take care of it and usually wind up being better for it!

 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

  • Win even through the Loss
  • Continue to work and push through the pain.

item.title: Reflection 9: Faith-Based Productivity
item.itunes:subtitle: PITQuestion from Konstantin Panin October 10, 2016
item.description:
Today Reflection is in response to a question from PIT Facebook Group Member Konstantin Panin. He asks: 

"How does my faith in Christ affect my work and productivity?"

My involvement in our Church (as a pastor) has allowed me to really put what I'm doing into perspective. I think about the bigger plan for me when I'm doing things. This allows me to say "yes" to more of the right things and "no" to more of the wrong things. 

 

Konstantin Panin - Facebook

 

My Takeaways for today (Click to Tweet):

  • Do everything like it is the most important thing ever
  • Examine the value of what you're doing

item.title: Reflection 8: Birthday and Reflections on This Year!
item.itunes:subtitle: October 5, 2016
item.description:
Tomorrow is my birthday! I've learned a lot this year.

I learned that I can do a lot. I did a lot this year, but I didn't do a "whole" lot.

Whole is a completing factor. Whole is the thing that makes you feel full.

I managed to accomplish many things but I still felt like I wasn't full... 

 

I learned that my wife and my family are "whole" factors. I learned my commitment to this community are "whole" factors.

 

 My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

  • Instead of working so much on everything, I want to focus on the things that make me whole.

item.title: Reflection 7: Stay Calm and Focus on the Single Point
item.itunes:subtitle: October 4, 2016
item.description:
I was cooler than a polar bear at the north pole eating ice-cream on a block of dry ice.

When the system crashed, I have kept a clear head and was able focus on the issue. I used that same principle to take things one step at a time and accomplish my tasks today.

 

 

 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

  • When it starts looking rough, just keep calm
  • Stay focused on the smaller goal with woring outside your comfort

item.title: Reflection 6: My New Digital Notebook and Taking it One Thing at a Time
item.itunes:subtitle: October 3, 2016
item.description:
I found a digital notebook replacement! It only took me two years!

  • inkdrop

 

My Takeaway for today (Click to Tweet):

  • Keep looking for the perfect thing for you!
  • Take it one thing at a time and truly focus on it.

item.title: Reflection 5: Good Enough is Better than Perfect
item.itunes:subtitle: September 30 - October 2, 2016
item.description:
This weekend I didn't do too much. It's been a long busy week, and I wanted to relax a bit. Only problem was there was my big project needed to be finished.

I had a lot of plans for this episode. A lot of little things I wanted to bring to it. 

In the end I produced my podcast episode. It was a little more flashy than I normally would do but it wasn't the massive production I envisioned at first. 

It was good enough

This reminded me of the quote  - "good enough is better than perfect"

I know that I should strive to be the best but I have to remember that if I hold off on things until they are perfect, they will never ship.

Takaways for the Day (Click to Tweet)

  • When working on something, make it good enough and move on.  
  • Good enough is better than perfect. #pitreflections

item.title: Reflection 4: Self-Worth, Gratitude, and Perspective
item.itunes:subtitle: September 29, 2016
item.description:
I've been a little hard on myself. I've been pushing myself to do more and more. It's time that I relaxed a bit. 

Why have I been so difficult. It's because I treat myself like a failure. 

I know it's not true. I should be lifting myself up, instead I'm tearing myself down. It's this torture that pushes me to work harder and harder to the point of even getting sick. 

Takeaways for today (Click to Tweet):

  • You are your biggest enemy when you should be your biggest fan!
  • Don't let your inner critic leave you wishing you could have done better!

item.title: Reflection 3: Proactive vs Reactive Work and Essentialism
item.itunes:subtitle: PIT Reflections 03: Today's Buffer Chat on Essentialism made me wonder about whether my job was proactive or reactive. This is very much like the conversation I had with Rob Freelow. Proactive - working towards and thinking about the things that you...
item.description:
PIT Reflections 03:

Today's Buffer Chat on Essentialism made me wonder about whether my job was proactive or reactive. This is very much like the conversation I had with Rob Freelow.

Proactive - working towards and thinking about the things that you would like to have instead of what is already there. 

Reactive - working on the things that are already in existence.

Essentialism - Making sure that you have an understanding of what is most important at the moment #bufferchat

Insights (Click to Tweet)

  • There are plenty of things fighting for the priority. Only accept the most important.

Links
#BufferChat - Buffer - A Smarter Way to Share on Social Media

Pit 32: Being A Background Superstar With Rob Frelow

item.title: Reflection 2: Being Authentic but Knowing your Audience
item.itunes:subtitle: Productivity in Tech Reflections Well I tried to be myself... Too bad the people I was talking to didn't really care about that. I'm learned another valuable lesson today. While it is important to be authentic and true to yourself....
item.description:
Productivity in Tech Reflections

 

Well I tried to be myself... Too bad the people I was talking to didn't really care about that. 

I'm learned another valuable lesson today. While it is important to be authentic and true to yourself. You have to remember that not everyone will be the audience that you are expecting them to be. 

The world isn't made of your cheerleaders shouting "Rah Rah Rah" for you. They have their own agenda. 

Today I wanted people to talk about being productive, but they just wanted to talk about their products. 

Overall my first conference was somewhat of a let down, I absolutely enjoyed the mixer and I think I could have did a lot of things better.

  • Listened to more talks
  • Did less Interviews
  • Talk with people mostly about their journey and not about what I wanted them to talk about (created friends instead of clients.)

I did meet a few people that I really enjoyed talking to. I wish I would have spent more time meeting people like that instead of scheduling interviews. 

That's okay I have some interviews and I have to make the best of it. 

Thoughts for the day (Click to Tweet):

  • Be Authentic but remember your audience
  • Cherish the relationships you can create over the business opportunities

Well, it's back to work tomorrow. I'm looking for to working with this new outlook, even if I'm not the most happy to return to work. 

Links

  • Startup Grind

item.title: Reflection 1: Fear, Anxiety, and Doing You
item.itunes:subtitle: Productivity in Tech Daily Reflections Daily reflections is a audio journal that I am sharing with you guys. I hope this will inspire you to record your thoughts and use them to come up with insights to guide you through your week. Last...
item.description:
Productivity in Tech

Daily Reflections

Daily reflections is a audio journal that I am sharing with you guys. I hope this will inspire you to record your thoughts and use them to come up with insights to guide you through your week. 

 

Last night was the Startup Grind Mixer. I was nervous. I had never talked with so many people about what I do. I planned to talk about my consultation stuff but it dawned on me.

I'M A FREAKING PODCASTER.

This lead me to just start interviewing people. I had so much fun and met a lot of great people. 

Today is Startup Grind. I'm super excited to go to my first conference. 

Thoughts for the day:

  • - Pay it Forward
  • - Don't worry about things that are you instead focus on what is.

 

Links

  • This Developing Story
  • Interview with Chad Bostick
  • Startup Grind
